data.title: new food is amazing
data.text: I've been coming to frosty for years but stopped coming because things were different. It's been over a year since I went back. I came in tonight with my parents to enjoy the football game. The new food was amazing. The sever Kayla made us feel like we were at home. Love the new staff and menu. Such a great experience. Thank you guys. We will be back for sure!!!

data.title: Food was good
data.text: We had the ultimate gator burger & the beer battered finger steaks. Both were good with fries...my husband ordered a Coke & it tasted weird...like not enough syrup..too much soda water.  Waitress gave us a new one which had the same taste...she said customers have been complaining about it for a few days...really after 2 days it hasn't been fixed!!!

data.title: Dog-Friendly Patio
data.text: Finding a dog-friendly patio where my pup can sit near/under the table was greatly appreciated while on a recent road trip. Temps were high, and there wasn't much of a breeze, so the patio was warm, but we were able to find a shady spot to enjoy lunch. Service was swift, and the food was good, typical pub fare.

data.title: Delicious food!
data.text: We ordered from The Frosty Gator because it delivers to hotels (and we were not in the mood for pizza).  The food was absolutely delicious — well seasoned and large portions.  They managed to get it to us in about thirty minutes, which was wonderful because we were too tired to go out to a restaurant.  It has reasonable prices too.

data.title: Excellent food and quick delivery!
data.text: We are making are way across the country.  After unloading our bags and checking into our room, we did not feel like going out for dinner.   The Frosty Gator came up as only one of a few places that deliver.  Even though I did not have a menu, the person who answered the phone walked me through items on the menu.  They had it delivered in under forty minutes.  The food was fantastic!  It is well seasoned (I had a wrap and my husband ate a brisket sandwich), and the portions were a great size.  They have lots of options.  It hit the spot for these tired a weary travelers.

data.title: Casual and freindly
data.text: Stopped in for a brew and stayed for dinner because they feature alligator.  I had it sautéed in a Cajun sauce.  Very good!

data.title: Delivered to the Hampton Inn by the airport!
data.text: GREAT food, excellent service!  The menu was available in the hotel room at the Hampton Inn, noticed lots of unique options so we called for delivery.  Could not have been easier to order (even with special details), and the person I spoke with was also the person who delivered the food.  Extremely nice, and the food was great.

data.title: Excellent menu
data.text: I had the Elk burger (yes real Elk meat and it was amazing) with avocado and cheddar. The burger was so big i threw the top away and ate it with a fork and knife. The best burger I ever had. Burger and 2 draft beers about $25. Lots of draft options. The whole menu is full of personality and the staff was excellent. If you are lucky you will get Jessie, she was so sweet.

data.title: Fun place with good food
data.text: We have eaten here twice for business meals.  It is not fancy at all so you have to want this laid back setting.  But the food is good and it is a great place to relax and chill.

data.title: worst burgers ever
data.text: I am from Maryland on a cross country trip and after 45 days this is the worst food I have EVER EVER had. Are you kidding me. This is supposedly a burger place specializing in elk an buffalo but nothing is FRESH so everything is VERY VERY well done like a rock. Avoid this place at all costs.

data.title: Average
data.text: Pub style greasy spoon.  Wait staff is friendly. Food has too much grease for my liking.  Decor is interesting.  Not one of my favorite spots in town.

data.title: Best Sports Bar in Town?
data.text: The atmosphere and service here is vanilla for sure. The food isn't consistently good but it's not consistently bad either. It may be the best sports bar in town in terms of food and service. Try the smoked wings or quesadilla. I would recommend this place to a friend before the Firehouse or Buffalo Wild Wings.

data.title: Bar Food
data.text: This is a decent place for a meal. They have a lot of beers on tap and the food is a little above standard bar food. Don't get me wrong, I've never had a bad meal here. It can get a little loud. In the summer they have a small patio that is nice.

data.title: Some of the best wings you will ever find
data.text: I travel a lot, but this is the only place I have found applewood smoked wings. They are not cheap, but some of the best wings I have every had.

data.title: Bad Bad Bad
data.text: Went in for a beer and a sandwich on April 19th. Heard from some friends that I work with that it was not bad. I get that it was a Friday night  but still no one came to my table. I had to go up to the bar and ask someone for a menu. I ordered a simple sandwich and beer. I got the wrong beer and the sandwich let's just say my 5 year old could have done better. The service was awful.They were to busy standing around talking by the bar. The kitchen is dirty, the prices are overpriced for what you get and the service was some of the worse I have ever had! I will not be going back.

data.title: LOVE this place
data.text: My husband and I were taking our teenage kids on one last trip before the start up of school.  We stopped here for the third time because we loved the food and the staff!  The kids love the burgers, salads for me and you can't go wrong with their steaks.  We were served quickly and the wait staff was attentive and fun!  Any reviewer that claims otherwise must have been having a bad day to begin with and probably treated the staff very disrespectfully.  I have been a waitress and I KNOW good service when I see it and I know how it feels to be disrespected for doing my job.  The Frosty Gator is  always on our list of MUST SWING IN to eat or have a drink!

data.title: Very BAD!!!!
data.text: Never had a French dip with warmed up left over pot roast  full of fat, now i have!!!!! Horrible! I told the server it wasn't good and she didn't care!!!

data.title: Err what happened??
data.text: This place used to be amazing, regulars out towners. Everyone use to go here. Not anymore, the owner can't seem to keep staff for more than a month and anyone who is there longer hates their jobs and you can tell. The prices went up on the menu however theres a whole new kitchen staff. Dont you have to have consistency, before you raise your prices. I can tell you this the food quality hasn't gone up since the prices have. Not to mention I've seen the owner in there a few times drinking, getting belige with customers and even one tine freak out a bartender in front of the whole restraunt. Bathrooms are filthy, ugly cement floor with carpet glue still visible, angry staff, high prices, the once popular deck is never full anymore  and falling apart. No money seems to be put into the place. Not how it use to be, I wish we had the old gator back. Hopefully he sells it and someone puts some back into it.

data.title: Rude Owner
data.text: Last night is the last time I will ever enter and spend money at the Frosty Gator.  The owner once again demonstrated a complete lack of regard for a concern I raised and I was treated in a manner that assures he will never profit from my hard earned dollars again.  In recent months customers have had to endure smaller portions and higher prices.  Their fish tacos were one of the better items on their menu but they are by far not the best in town (Snake Bite takes first place and is right around the corner).  There are too many great places in Idaho Falls to eat where customer service, value, and quality of product are much greater than what the Frosty Gator offers.  It is sad that the current owner is intent on disrespecting his customers.

data.title: Food is ok, service sucks
data.text:
We stop here coming home from Yellowstone.  First the doors were locked when the signed said open. After we tried a couple of times we started to leave when a waitress came out and said they were opened and the doors were locked.  (Well duh, we figured that out on our own.)

We sat down got menus and our drink orders pretty promptly but that was the last of the good service.

There was 7 of us and it took a really long time to get our food. I should also mention we were the only ones there. 

The BLTs and sandwiches were ok, the zucchini sticks were yummy. We had to ask for a ticket 3 times and finally someone other than our waitress brought it out to us.

The restrooms were dirty, but honestly I was too surprised by this.   

The prices were fair, just remember you get what you pay for.
